results.title: Dr DeBakey
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer and Harold Mayer Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
The story of Dr Michael DeBakey, world renowned heart specialist and innovator of new techniques in surgery and new materials for building body organs. We follow Dr DeBakey from early morning through the entire day, forever fighting the clock.

results.title: Blaine Johnson
results.creator_credit: Gordon Weisenborn, Sarah Toughill, Werner Schumann and Guggenheim Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Pilot, specialist in farm technology and “crop duster”, Blaine Johnson’s knowledge and study of the latest developments of agriculture benefit the many farms he visits as a duster pilot. Johnson places his skills at the service of the farming community who need him to combat the many kinds of insects which can destroy a crop overnight.

results.title: Blinky Bill
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Blinky Bill the Koala sets off to try and find his mother after their peaceful bush home is destroyed by loggers. He meets new friends and has many adventures along the way in this delightful animated film, based on Dorothy Wall’s classic story.
results.description: Blinky Bill the Koala sets off to try and find his mother after their peaceful bush home is destroyed by loggers. He meets new friends and has many adventures along the way in this delightful animated film, based on Dorothy Wall’s classic story.

results.title: Blinkity blank
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film experiment by Norman McLaren in the use of intermittent animation and spasmodic imagery. McLaren makes play with the laws relating to persistence of vision and after image on the retina of the eye. By engraving non-representational visuals directly on black, emulsion-coated films in interrupted sequence, he achieves a ‘Now you see it, now you don’t effect. The music background is in the form of semi-free instrumental improvisation, with percussive effects added by synthetic sounds scratched directly on film. (Awards: London, Cannes, Edinburgh, Berlin, Los Angeles)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman McLaren, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Bliss
results.creator_credit: Ray Lawrence, Anthony Buckley, New South Wales Film Corporation and Window III
results.brief_description: Bliss is the story of a man who so misunderstood the world that he almost got it right. The man is Harry Joy, he is happy, he has a successful business, a lovely wife and two loving children. When he dies, his life is ruined. He comes back to life and takes a good look at the world around him. His wife is sleeping with his partner, half of everything he eats causes cancer and an elephant sits on his car. No wonder Harry Joy believes that he has gone to hell. This film is based on the novel by Peter Carey. Cast includes Barry Otto, Lynette Curran, Helen Jones, Miles Buchanan and Gia Carides.

results.title: Blanche et Claire
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote, Paul Larose and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Showing the relationship between two women of different ages who share their feelings and dreams, this film causes us to reflect on the right to dream in a world where dreams have no value.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy L. Cote, Paul Larose and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Blindness
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of a man who lost his sight during the best years of his life. Filmed with the help of the Canadian National Institute for the Blind, this study of blindness tries to show the emotional effect of the sudden loss of sight and how a man so stricken climbs back from the brink of despair. How he learns a trade which enables him to support himself and eventually a family, is a story of quiet triumph convincingly portrayed. Starring Len Cariou
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morten Parker, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Blanche
results.creator_credit: Walerian Borowczyk, Jean-Claude Lefevre, Abel & Charton and Telepresse Films
results.brief_description:
Set in 13th century France, this dark Arthurian tragedy centres on Blanche, the beautiful young wife of an ageing baron, who falls prey to the lusts of three men: her stepson, the king, and his page. Blanche is identified with a caged white dove; around her frightened flutterings her would-be lovers come to grief, one of them literally imprisoned in her bricked-up boudoir. Borowczyk’s initial interest in recreating the period and depicting courtly intrigue is gradually replaced by his characteristic cold, flat formalism - instead of fleshing out his main character (glimpsed stepping out of the bath at the start of the film) Borowczyk turns Blanche into an automaton. Yet despite its almost inhuman, pitiless cruelty, the film achieves a kind of tragic catharsis. Also available on 16mm.

Credits: Producer, Jean-Claude Lefevre ; director, writer, editor, Walerian Borowczyk ; photography, Guy Durban ; production designer, Jacques D’Ovidio ; editor, Charles Bretoneiche.
Cast: Ligia Branice, Michel Simon, Lawrence Trimble, Jacques Perrin, Georges Wilson.

results.title: Blake
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Douglas Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this age, when most people follow their dreams passively on the television screen, there are still a few individuals whose passion is for the real thing. Here is a film about such a one, with a passion for wings and the freedom of the skies. Filmed by Bill Mason, whose own devotion is to the canoe, the subject here is his friend Blake James, another filmmaker, who pilots his own one-man plane. The film is Mason’s view of this “hobo of the skies” but it is also an adventure. Photography: Bill Mason, Blake James. (Five awards, including Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)
